p: Sudden cardiac death (SCD) caused by ventricular fibrillation (VF) during acute myocardial infarction (MI) is a major cause of cardiovascular mortality.[ 1â€“ 3] Susceptibility to VF during acute ischemia is undoubtedly multifactorial and modulated by several factors, including autonomic dysregulation, electrolyte disturbance, hemodynamic dysfunction, inherited factors, and various environmental influences.[ 1, 4, 5]
